comment.author: 62233671@N03
comment._content: This is a fabulous idea. I know here in the States, more and more museums are coming up with ways for accesability. At the Smithsonian Folklife Festival, there was a special tour for the blind in which they could touch the crafts and other artifacts that the general public usually couldn't. I went to an exhibit at National Geographic in which all the captions of things were written in braille, sound was incorporated, and even charts were duplicated in raised forms.
